ch.unifr.pai.twice.dragndrop.client
Class MPDragNDrop

java.lang.Object
  ch.unifr.pai.twice.dragndrop.client.MPDragNDrop
All Implemented Interfaces:
DragNDrop.DragNDropIntf
Direct Known Subclasses:
TouchDragNDrop
 class MPDragNDrop
extends java.lang.Object
implements DragNDrop.DragNDropIntf

A drag and drop implementation for multiple mouse pointers (as well as single mouse pointers)

Author:
Oliver Schmid

makeDraggable

public void makeDraggable(Draggable w,
                          DragConfiguration conf,
                          com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element dragProxyTemplate)
Description copied from interface: DragNDrop.DragNDropIntf
Registers a widget implementing the interface Draggable to be draggable while providing a DragConfiguration which shall be applied to the drags for this widget as well as a HTML element to be a template for the drag proxy (the element which is shown in a semi-transparent way below the mouse pointer during the drag)

Specified by:
makeDraggable in interface DragNDrop.DragNDropIntf
Parameters:
w - - the widget that shall be made draggable
conf - - the DragConfiguration which shall be applied to a drag of this widget
dragProxyTemplate - - a HTML element which acts as a template for the drag proxy of this widget
See Also:
Make the widget draggable by attaching a drag handler to it. If the drag handler is invoked, the logic checks if the widget is currently draggable (e.g. not locked by another user) and starts the drag by the invocation of {@link MPDragNDrop#startDrag(Widget, String, int, int, DragConfiguration, Element)} after making sure, that the delay defined by {@link MPDragNDrop#getDragDelayInMs()} is exceeded and it therefore is a valid drag

                         java.lang.String deviceId,

endDrag

protected void endDrag(java.lang.String deviceId,
                       com.google.gwt.user.client.Event event)
Functionality triggered on the end of the drag (e.g. the release of the mouse button). This method resets all the necessary management as well as the event preview needed during the drag. It checks if the element is dropped above a drop target and triggers the event on the drop target. Additionally, it checks if the drag and drop handler accepts the drop (if DragNDropHandler.onDrop(String, Widget, int, int, Event, DropTargetHandler, boolean) returns true). If there is a drop target available, it will hand over the information about the acceptance or the rejection of the drop through the widget itself as part of the parameters ("resetByOwner") and lets the drop target decide how to handle the situation. If there is no drop target available and the drop is rejected, the widget is repositioned to its original coordinates. In the end, the onEndHover logic is invoked for the drag and drop handler.

Parameters:
deviceId -
event -

getHandlerOfDropTarget

protected Triple<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double,DropTargetHandler> getHandlerOfDropTarget()
Returns:
the information of the percentage of the area of the dragged proxy which intersects with the drop target, the percentage of the drop target area which is covered by the proxy and the drop target handler or null if no drop target intersects with the dragged widget

protected long getAreaOfWidget(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element e)
Parameters:
e - - a HTML element
Returns:
the area of the HTML element in square pixels

outOfBox

protected boolean outOfBox(com.google.gwt.user.client.Event event)
If the configuration of the drag defines a bounding box (a specific area which can not be left by the dragged widget), this method checks if the widget will be outside of the box by the application of the given event

Parameters:
event - to be applied
Returns:
if the widget is outside of the defined bounding box

setPosition

protected void setPosition(int x,
                           int y,
                           boolean withOffset)
Repositions the dragged widget to a specific x and y position taking into account the offset between the original widget coordinates and the mouse pointer position at the begin of the drag. The offset is kept in percentages to make the offset calculation independent of the drag-proxy size.

Parameters:
x -
y -
withOffset -

resetPosition

protected void resetPosition()
Resets the position of the dragged widget to its original coordinates and removes the dragging styles

getHoverDropTarget

protected Tuple<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget,java.lang.Long> getHoverDropTarget(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element e)
Returns the drop target that has the highest priority and that has the biggest intersection area with the given element.

Parameters:
e -
Returns:
a tuple of the drop target widget and the intersecting area or null if the element does not intersect with another element

getCollisionArea

protected long getCollisionArea(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element left,
                                com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element right,
                                com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element top,
                                com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element bottom)
This method takes two different elements which are passed multiple times depending on their relative position and calculates the collision area in square pixels.

Parameters:
left - - the element which is further left than the other
right - - the element which is further right than the other
top - - the element which is further top than the other
bottom - - the element which is further bottom than the other
Returns:
the collision area between the elements in square pixels

getAffectedDropTargets

protected java.util.Set<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget> getAffectedDropTargets(com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element e)
This method looks up all the drop targets which are intersecting with the given element. If the drop targets differ in their priorities (DropTargetHandlerFactory.Priority ), only widgets of the highest priority are returned.

Parameters:
e - - a HTML element (typically the HTML element of the dragged widget)
Returns:
the drop target widgets which are intersecting with the given element and do have the highest priority

setDropHandler

public void setDropHandler(com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasMouseOverHandlers w,
                           DropTargetHandler dropHandler,
                           boolean hoverAware)
Description copied from interface: DragNDrop.DragNDropIntf
This method allows to register a widget that implements HasMouseOverHandlers to become a drop target. The corresponding methods of the provided DropTargetHandler will be invoked if a widget is dragged while hovering this widget.

Specified by:
setDropHandler in interface DragNDrop.DragNDropIntf
Parameters:
w - - the widget that shall be registered as a drop target
dropHandler - - the DropTargetHandler defining the actions that shall be taken if a widget is dragged while hovering the widget
hoverAware - - to make a drop target aware if a widget hovers it might have negative impact for the performance. If the drop target does not need to react on the hovering of dragged widgets but only on drops of them while overlaying the widgets area, this property should be set to false. If this property is set to false, the methods DropTargetHandler.onHover(String, Widget, Element, com.google.gwt.user.client.Event, Double, Double) and DropTargetHandler.onHoverEnd(String, Widget, Element, com.google.gwt.user.client.Event) will not be triggered.

removeDropHandler

public void removeDropHandler(com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasMouseOverHandlers w)
Description copied from interface: DragNDrop.DragNDropIntf
Unregisters the widget implementing HasMouseOverHandlers to be a drop handler.

Specified by:
removeDropHandler in interface DragNDrop.DragNDropIntf
